website_summaries.verdict: Protective with improved shock absorbency, these kickboxing gloves are the industry standard for training and sparring.
pros: Features ThumbLock feature for better safety
Full padding up front, wrist and back
Easy to put on and secure
cons: Some users complain of a strong chemical odor

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for a friend with cancer as a reminder ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a friend with cancer as a reminder and inspiration to fight with all she has. They are working.
customer_reviews.author: maxx12

customer_reviews.title: Really nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit my 11 year olds hands perfectly. This was on his wish list for Christmas so he was excited when he opened them. He said they are very comfortable to wear. I purchased the 12 ounce gloves. My son likes using these gloves with his punching bag and told me that his hands don’t really get sweaty inside. I have tried these as well because I have small hands and they are really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because I thought Everlast was a trusted brand and quality product. What I received was a pair of boxing gloves that already look used and worn out even though I’ve only had them for a week and some change (1/5/18). I try to get at least 15-30mins a day on my bag and I can tell these won’t last long so if you’re planning on doing serious training for a longer period of time do not buy these. They are poorly stitched I give them another month before they start falling apart I’ve already started looking into other brands. Sometimes choosing a known brand does not guarantee a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Tiki19

customer_reviews.title: Everything's cool.
customer_reviews.text: A little snug, but that's because of my huge, stupid hands. Can't wear with wraps if your paws are ginormous, but that's nobody's fault, and unless you are trying to crush the bag, it presents no issue. If you are trying to crush the bag, spend more on gloves, dummy. To all of the people hating on these gloves: you're never going pro. Relax. They're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few months to post to make sure they didn't disintegrate on my hands. So far, they've held up really well to some tough sessions. Of course, I'm a small female, so my max punching power is probably 50% of most reasonably fit/trained boxers - so take this review with a grain of salt and don't blame me if you punch through these in a month! Anyway, they're great training gloves. Not too heavy, but weighty enough to get a great workout in and fatigue your arms. Aside from a loose thread here or there that was easily snipped off and doesn't impact the structural integrity of the gloves, they show no wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Prefect fit!
customer_reviews.text: This product fit perfectly on my hands and so happy with the great quality for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Tess Eagleman

customer_reviews.title: Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I’ve semi-regularly used these gloves (12 oz) for 2 years mainly for bag work with some mitt work - a few times a week most of the time, a couple of times a month occasionally. Some of the creases in the vinyl stuff has faded a little, but I’ve not had any seams bust or anything like that. They definitely take a beating. The only drawback is that they could use a bit more wrist support at the sides of the wrist. That’s the only reason I knocked off 1 star. They do what you need them to do, and they’re pretty durable. What else do you need in a training glove?
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Jaques

customer_reviews.title: initially i was very happy with the product but after few months of use ...
customer_reviews.text: is tarted kickboxing a year and a half ago. after 8 months of MMA gloves use i switched to these boxing gloves. initially i was very happy with the product but after few months of use the strap of the right gloves give on opening every 2-3 punches until its not possible to train with them. so its a good purchase for someone who may not train more than 1-2 a week but even than it will not last more than 6 months. maybe my expectations are high from it but i believe that boxing gloves should server for few years not few months.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Only for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is only good for light work, if you're shadow boxing, or self teaching. Do NOT use these if you're more advanced, if you're going to take boxing classes and hitting the bag relatively hard. I bought these and after a few minutes, my knuckles started to hurt because these gloves do not provide adequate protection. Get something with more padding to PROTECT YOUR FISTS. In hindsight, I wouldn't have bought these specific gloves.
customer_reviews.author: James G

customer_reviews.title: Completely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use these every time I box they are so comfortable. I have super tiny hands and was having a lot of trouble finding something that fit well. These are great because I can use them and my sister borrowed them and her hands are not very small and they worked for her too. I use these with wraps and they work perfectly. Haven’t had issues with my knuckles getting cut up with these either which happened to me in a lot of gloves cause my hands had too much room. These are definitely worth your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer English

customer_reviews.title: Pay another 20 to 30 bucks and get a better glove
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the glove says cheap. spend another $20 on another brand and get a much better glove. I have heard good things about the more expensive Everlast gloves but have never tryed them. I didnt like the everlast so I went and payed 42 bucks and got the ringside apex bag gloves and they just seem so much better built with better padding. The finger area of the ringside apex is a little tight fitting but they are really amazon gloves for the price. If your new to boxing just remmber there is a differnts between bag gloves and sparring gloves.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Might be what you’re looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to hit the bag at boxing camp. I’m not a boxer by any means. I guess they’re decent quality, but they’re shiny and scream cheap to me. They also don’t feel that great on my hand. I purchased 2 different brands of gloves to compare and these are going back. I did try a really expensive leather pair of gloves elsewhere and these Everlast don’t compare on comfort. If it helps, my hand is just about 7.5” from wrist to fingertip. They’re too...long and roomy inside.
customer_reviews.author: RaShonda

customer_reviews.title: ... gloves for kickboxing classes and they have held up nicely. I think they are good quality especially for ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for kickboxing classes and they have held up nicely. I think they are good quality especially for the price. I recommend these to anyone who is just starting out with boxing/kickboxing. I'm 5'7 120lbs and found the smaller 8oz sized gloves fit good. If it helps to gauge size, I wear a size small latex/nitrile glove. If you have long fingers, you'll probably want the bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Sairisan

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Better than the store bought gloves. Good protection and keeps my wrist protected. I have small hands and they worked fine. My only complaint is that I tried to order 12 oz. gloves and they would have charged me to return the 14 oz. that I ordered by mistake. So pay attention to the weight of the gloves when ordering. I kept the 14 oz. and so far they are okay.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Classic red gloves just like in the movies
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty big gloves for my size S hands but then again I selected fourteen ounce. I've never heard of gloves being measured in ounces but I didn't really have to make a choice since fourteen ounce gloves were the only size left to order. The large size actually makes them excellent for blocking and you can really pound a bag with these even if you have sore bruised hands. The mesh material makes them so breathable I can feel the breeze when I go outside to work out. The faux leather synthetic material is surprisingly tough and could probably be easily sanitized with a spray. These are extremely high quality and sewn well with appropiate materials.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wiggin

customer_reviews.title: Simple, good name I know and trust
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a normal guy in my 50s...got a heavy bag hung up in my shed and started to add some boxing to my workouts. Hey, Sly was 59/60 in the Balboa movie, haha! These gloves are great for me. Easy to get on/off and I'm sorta old school in the Everlast IS boxing to me...and my age group probably. I've seen the grand in gyms ally life. I got an Everlast heavy bag at Dicks recently (curbside with the coronavirus) but the gloves were easier to get on Amazon. Also got a double end bag. I'm not in any way competing, just enjoying some good workouts.
customer_reviews.author: solocanoe

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the bad reviews must be a different product because I have used and abused these (in all ounces) and have yet to wear a set out. I’m a light heavyweight that trains on numerous bags (heavy, wave master, double end bag, speed bag, striker, mitts). I box up to 10 hours a week and positively love these gloves. I’ve really been enjoying the 16oz gloves for bag work instead of sparring lately and they fit my Winning knuckle guards and hand wraps perfectly. I don’t need any other gloves. Everlast was plenty good enough for the greatest boxers of all time.
customer_reviews.author: KP27

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh, get Hayabusa's
customer_reviews.text: Would only recommend these for beginners. Use them for maybe 2-3 weeks to see if you're truly going to keep at it with boxing and bag training. If you decide it's for you, buy quality ones like I did. I got Hayabusa T3 training gloves and WOW! I was shooketh on how much better they felt, how superb the wrist support was, hand protection, durability, color options, everything. Highly recommend checking them out!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hill

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding gloves and value...but no head shots.
customer_reviews.text: They look and feel like I think proper boxing gloves should be, but for my sons, they're not nearly soft or cushiony enough for head/face shots. Having them hit shoulders and below, and hitting a bag to get them more broken in and hopefully softer. Otherwise they're useless because these are not safe for teens or grownups to be doing any meaningful boxing with.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Gloves/Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: As stated by some other reviewers, these gloves performed decently for a beginner for about three months before the stitching on the strap began tearing. My gloves are now unusable and I really wish I had spent more money on higher-quality, more expensive gloves. I guess you get what you pay for considering the low price, but I really think purchasing these gloves is a poor decision and a waste of money. If you'd like to get more than a few months use out of your boxing gloves, buy better quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: Caramel Bear

customer_reviews.title: I love pink!
customer_reviews.text: I just started my kick boxing class last week and I love them!! The shipping was fast and the price was awesome for a beginner in boxing. My hands were sweaty after wearing them for a long period of time however it doesn’t stop me from working hard in the gym. I highly suggested to buy the hand wraps. The hand wraps do not protect your hands from an impact as boxing gloves, but they help to keep the fist in proper shape and support the wrist by keeping it aligned, while you're delivering a punch.
customer_reviews.author: Tocara’s Palace

customer_reviews.title: Good for gym use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my old gloves for kickboxing classes. They only have a new glove smell at first. Let them sit out over night with drier sheets in them. Good to go. Mountain breeze freshness. I do the same after use as well. Wear wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Moses

customer_reviews.title: I like these gloves but other reviewers are correct that they ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves but other reviewers are correct that they are TINY. I bought the 8 oz gloves because I have small hands (I'm 5'2"). Even without wraps they are difficult to get on (mostly because of length rather than width). I think they get easier to put on each time I do it, so I'm keeping them but unless you have real real small hands, order a size or two up.
customer_reviews.author: Kate F

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves For The $$$
customer_reviews.text: Got my 5 year old a set of gloves to keep him busy during all this Covid-19 nonsense and so I grabbed myself a pair as well. For the price these are pretty nice gloves. They do the job when I'm sparring on my knees with my little dude. Just the right weight. Comfortable. Easy to attach. If you wanna spar with your kids during all this madness, these are the gloves I bought and they work perfectly. Get that aggression out safely. Rock on!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sinister

customer_reviews.title: Good padding & ventilation, good price
customer_reviews.text: I picked these gloves because I am familiar with the Everlast brand and the reviews were quite good. But the best thing about these gloves is the mesh system in the palm area of the gloves. Since boxing gloves get super sweaty, it's important that you AIR them out to dry and to avoid them from getting stinky. The mesh system allows for the gloves to dry more easily and quickly than non-mesh gloves. I'm sure after 6 months they'll also get stinky as there's no way to prevent this from happening at some point in time.
customer_reviews.author: Eileog

customer_reviews.title: Nice full sized gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice...I used these for my heavybag routine as soon as they arrived. Great fit, with my hand wraps on, the sizing was spot on. Lots of padding in the contact zone, good elastic, velcro and wrist support. The palms have some ventilation. The weight of 16 oz. gives the cardio, and upper body toning I was looking for. I recommend these. I can not speak to longterm durability at this time but these held up well to a full out. (Compared to other gloves I have tried in the past that did not even survive 5 rounds.)
customer_reviews.author: Blues Player

customer_reviews.title: "Yes my gloves are hot pink... got a problem with that?"
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for heavy bag work during a kickboxing class and I absolutely love them! They are breathable but secure. While they have a little less padding over the striking area than I'm used to, it makes for more maneuverability and ensures you're making proper contact. Also, the hot pink is really cute ;)
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: No support, little padding
customer_reviews.text: I used these 12 oz gloves for kickboxing and heavy bag work and they were too thin (very little knuckle padding). I only used them once because my hands and fingers ached so bad after my workout. Also, the wrist straps are elastic and are too long. The straps also provide no wrist support. I really wish I would’ve used the gloves within the return period because they were a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: kick boxing dream
customer_reviews.text: I took up kickboxing and was using wraps and cloth around my hands and would tear up my knuckles and fingers. I got these gloves and i can now pound away as hard as i can punch and i have no issues. i love these gloves. i have smaller hands and i do feel the ends of the gloves but you do not want to size up as the next size up would be huge. i am 5ft 4 125lbs and have average sized hands for my height. my freind is 5ft9 and she uses the 12oz gloves.
customer_reviews.author: ingrid

customer_reviews.title: good gloves...Everlast is always good
customer_reviews.text: these are great for training for a 4oz MMA fight if I'm training in boxing or sparring I use my 16oz but these are good to use for Mitts n Heavy Bag for MMA training.........one negative is the Velcro strap ripped off but I sowed it back on cause I'm skilled like that
customer_reviews.author: derrick bronson

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and rugged. Soft feel inside gloves. Good protection.
customer_reviews.text: the following review is made using voice to text please pardon and or excuse grammatical and or punctuation errors.. I was a little hesitant at first to order these gloves because of a few negative remarks that I saw however, me being an intermediate boxer and a strong puncher, I can assure you that the set of gloves that I ordered fare terrific . They are very rugged I use them to hit the double-end bag as well as a punching bag I am very happy with my purchase I can assure you, these are good gloves.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Toxic smell like gasoline, returned immediately
customer_reviews.text: I've been training in boxing since 2006, so my tolerance for bad smells - moldy showers, summer sour sweat, no air conditioning, unclean pads, and used equipment - is pretty high. These gloves stink like nothing I've ever encountered in any boxing gym. I returned them immediately. They smelled like a combination of bad plastic, overpowering gasoline and something toxic I don't have a name for. I had them in a box during a Christmas party, and someone halfway across the room said, "What is that smell?" It was that bad. WARNING: Do NOT buy these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't order these if you want the ones in the picture.
customer_reviews.text: Received the gloves, they aren't the ones that are pictured for sale, they are the older style gloves...the plain old basic ones but at lest they got the color right. Wife wanted the ones they show on this page, she got the ones she doesn't want. She's disappointed therefore I'm disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: goldie

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves! 🥊
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! I was having a lot of hand pain after kickboxing, sometimes for up to a week and I tried a lot of different things. Hand wraps, gel, etc. Finally realized that I was using the wrong weight of gloves. After getting these (14 oz) my hands and knuckles no longer hurt after my workout. Wish I had them sooner! Love the black as well. Very sleek, not too bulky, and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel P

customer_reviews.title: good initial quality and feel
customer_reviews.text: the gloves that came with my heavy bag were out, so got these as a replacement. Was expecting better quality in this new pair, but they are WAY better than the originals! I'm not into boxing, but I'd think these are perfectly acceptable for use in a real match! If I bought $25 hockey gloves (a sport I do play), and they were of this quality, I would be thrilled with the deal I just got! So unless they start falling apart a year from now from using them a few times a week, these are a great deal in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: oTTo the CzAR

customer_reviews.title: Sure the Pink is intense...
customer_reviews.text: Great Gloves, do the job. Better still: Every time I go to the gym with these gloves, people talk to me about them and give me complements on them. Since my gym is like a community it also got me talking to some new people.
customer_reviews.author: MartysReads

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, item is exactly as description, great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Update: I purchased these gloves in 2015 and they look as good as the day I purchased them. Boxing daily they have held up the test of time. Everlast has been a quality glove and a name brand of boxing for years and I definitely think it’s worth the price. Very comfortable and came exactly as described. Shipped fast!
customer_reviews.author: SoVast

customer_reviews.title: Toys at best
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like these at all. The thumbless design is totally uncool and a danger to your bare skin on a heavy bag or a reflex ball. The padded area in the palms for you to grip is way too small and useless, leaving your hands unprotected yet again. The gloves themselves are toys at best and nothing any serious training person would ever use on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Not enough padding. I still managed to get ribs broken by 90lb girlfriend. Unwanted advances so kept her stance. Cornered me and left right left right left left left up center side side ribs ribs front ribs, forhead and one in left eye. almost a KO. I got back up but fell and failed for the count. I then secretly keyed her car the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Robert mustache

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves for The Charm'tastic Mile Sports Display
customer_reviews.text: These Everlast boxing gloves were used by The Charm'tastic Mile (Love That 1.3) as a display item for Fight Week in Baltimore to help promote the Gervonta "Tank" Davis vs Ricardo Nunez WBA World Super Featherweight Fight in July. They were seen in restaurants and hotels around town. We look forward to getting more of them again for future boxing themed events. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: The Charmtastic Mile

customer_reviews.title: Good glove, its Everlast
customer_reviews.text: Everlast always a good glove. Feel like an alien wearing another boxing glove brand. I abuse my gloves and only get a couple of months out of them if lucky. So expensive or gel gloves make no sense for me. A gel glove falling apart after 3 weeks is upsetting. An expensive glove wearing through after 2 months is very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Boke Jones

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves - for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Thes gloves exceeded my expectations for starting set. I got these for my daughter for sparing, she's previously been taking boxing classes and appreciated the comfort of the gloves and quality. She hasn't had any problems with them. I would recommend them to any beginner or looking for training gloves. They are easy to clean and quality of material is great.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set of gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I use my gloves for an hour long boxing class about twice a week. I've had them for about 2 months now and they are holding up perfectly fine. I haven't had one issue yet and they work well for what I got them for.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica DeAngelis

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I like the lighter wrist area compared to my other gloves. These are better for speed, but still have a good amount of size and weight to them to help build a little more strength. Good balance of lightness, size, and enough weight to feel just right. Quality and very durable as expected of all my Everlast gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable amd inexpensive. They are great for beginners, but they will not last long. I have experience in boxing and muay Thai and they did not lasted three months without starting to peel. However, I do have combat experience, so I go very hard at the bags and other drills/sparring, thus maybe a beginner can have them last or a bit longer than me.
customer_reviews.author: Héctor

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for occasional/ beginner boxers
customer_reviews.text: They are descent gloves for the price. If you just hit the bags occasionally and don't need anything exceptional than get these. Takes a few sessions to break them in. If you accurately get the right size based on instructions then they should fit easy and Velcro to keep them on your hands works fairly well. If your a hard hitter they can come undone though. Like I said occasional or beginner boxers these are perfectly fine and if you don't want anything fancy just get these. Can't say anything about durability at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture shows "Evershield" but gloves do not have that wrist protection feature.
customer_reviews.text: Product received did not match the picture and description. Picture shows "Evershield" on back of wrist, something used to stiffen the wrist and protect it. But product arrived does not have "Evershield" backing. It just has a big Everlast logo. Very misleading!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Slight difference in wrist velcro
customer_reviews.text: Depending on if someone has a preference or not, they might not like the shorter velcro latch, as opposed to the more common "velcro wrap" gloves. Other than that distinction, there is no difference between this newer glove and my older version. Very nice glove!
customer_reviews.author: WLH

customer_reviews.title: Worthy of 4 stars, but read below
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and are a great product, but it has this smell to them. Like an industrial petroleum gasoline smell that was so strong it made my closet smell like a gas station. Eventually (and I mean a long eventually) the smell went away. It's still a good product, but I recommend trying to wash them by hand or by themselves in the washer a few times to get the stench out. Other than that, the padding is durable. Very functional for my boxing classes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniele

customer_reviews.title: If he dies he dies
customer_reviews.text: Upon putting them on the Rocky theme (or Creed for you 21st century kids) kicked on, I yelled, and punched a hole through our wall. I’ve never taken them off. Showering, making love, eating oatmeal...it led to my bosses liberating me from employment but man are these gloves comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Zoltar's Nightmare

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy! Twice now!
customer_reviews.text: We all have different sizes hands...we all can use them! Only thing is, I wish it had better wrist support. But wrap an Ace wrap before sparing air bag punches and with the gloves theres no problem. Great for the money! Bought two sets! Used daily for a month now, and before that had the same set for 5 years before deciding to purchase new ones just because of some peeling.
customer_reviews.author: BSTARK

customer_reviews.title: "Everlast" says it all...
customer_reviews.text: Everlast is all you have to say. Great gloves for the price. Comes with a netted bag for storage. Fots and ferls great once you put them on. Your punches will have an "Extra Pep" to them with these on. Well made brand with a distinctive "Boxing History". Truly happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Indy

customer_reviews.title: Decent glove for a newbie
customer_reviews.text: I just started a kickboxing class at my gym and needed an inexpensive but decent pair of training gloves to use. They are OK for my purposes, I am a 58 year old male, but do work out with weights and have been told I have a rather hard punch. So sometimes after working on the bag for a while my knuckles and fingers are a little sore. The wrist supports are not very good, but again I do work out with weights and have not had any soreness of my wrists after a workout, However, I have friends with the same or similar gloves who have complained about sore wrist after a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Ron - Roanoke VA

customer_reviews.title: simple and good gloves for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of expensive gloves for a while that were very difficult to clean because they had a strap you couldn't remove. So, it was hard to clean/deodorize the gloves. odors just hung out in there, because there was pretty much no were for them to go. However, these ones I think are just better in general. these ones are good there is a bit less wrist support then you might get in a more expensive glove but, I got these for like 25 dollars there easily replaceable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: aaron smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good quality, really like them
customer_reviews.text: I've only used these specific gloves a few times, but compared to my old ones, that i loved, they are just as good. They are comfortable, and they allow me to hit the bag without hurting my hand - which is the whole point. They seem to be good quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: SmileyB7

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great product! I just started training for the first time and they are comfortable and easy to use. They aren’t super heavy either so you aren’t getting fatigued quickly. They are extremely easy to put on and overall there’s not a single thing I could say negatively about them. If you’re a beginner like me I would go with this brand, they aren’t expensive for the quality of the gloves and they keep your hands very supported. Will definitely be buying more from everlast!
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Great product for heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: Amateur boxer (i Just hit the Bag for exercise lol) I workout really hard, my workout moto is "kys" I have really put these through the paces Probably around 100 workouts with these, hitting a heavy bag. I'm a big guy and i hit hard, great product
customer_reviews.author: Kirbythebamf

customer_reviews.title: great wrist support!
customer_reviews.text: these gloves are GREAT! I was a bit skeptical at first that they would be strong enough for me (6'8 - 260 lbs). I am impressed with the durability, thus far, and support that I feel while hitting the heavy bag with these gloves. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Great except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. I had to use a different pair one time when I forgot mine for my kickboxing class, and I was so miserable. This fit my hands well, they don't smell, and they look great. That being said, I did have to duct tape one of the velcro straps that was starting to come off after only a few months. That's held it together pretty well, but it was kind of frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and not bulky at all
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and not bulky at all. I use them without any tape on an heavy bag, mostly for speed and technique rather than power. Due to the fact that they have no wrist support, if you go hard with these you might hurt your wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Domenico

customer_reviews.title: Fine gloves, terrible smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use in my MMA-style kickboxing class. They smell worse than anything in my gym bag, and that's saying something. I'm actually hoping the stink of my sweaty t-shirts and socks soaks into these gloves a little bit to offset the smell of recycled Chinese plastic. My only other comment is that they could use a little tab or pull or something on the Velcro wrist flaps; once you have one glove on it's nigh impossible to grip the edge of the wrist flap to secure the other glove. I'm going to have to sew one on myself to make these more functional.
customer_reviews.author: M.K. Hobson

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Someone told me to get 16oz for hitting bags so I ordered a pair. they feel a bit big but overall (after 10 classes or so), they’re holding up well and fairly comfortably. I can’t imagine they’d be great for years but as a beginner, these are exactly what I need (for the right price)
customer_reviews.author: Mrspotta

customer_reviews.title: Great for adults and tweens
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for myself and my tween sons - we have a speed/punching bag on a stand, and the gloves that came with it were basically useless, no padding at all. These have been great, reasonable price and do the job.
customer_reviews.author: DianaM

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very well made. The seam stitching and thickness of the wrist 'straps'.... all of it is top notch! Though, this is my first pair of gloves, I have nothing to compare it to other than my critical eye for detail. I have small hands, or average for a woman who is 5'1". With the hand wraps, they make these gloves SNUG! I definitely need help putting the second glove on if my hands are wrapped. I think, over time, this might loosen up as I use the gloves more and more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nevis

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the velcro straps
customer_reviews.text: Similar to a few other customer reviews, my 16 oz. pair of boxing gloves began to fall apart. After a few months of light\moderate use, the stitching which hold the Velcro straps has begun unlacing. I attempted to replace them because I did not misuse them, only light training once a week, so the issue is clearly with the manufacturer. The replacement time period has expired, however, and I am left with one of the gloves with the stitching completely undone, and the integrity of the glove is ruined. I do not recommend buying this product until they fix the faulty gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cute for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great boxing gloves for beginners! These gloves are great for the boutique/studio boxing classes. I've used these gloves at least 4-5X a week for the last year when I signed-up for boxing classes on ClassPass. Many people in the class have upgraded to higher quality gloves (more padding)... but I would def recommend this product for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Seem okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used them 6-7 times so far so cannot speak to the durability yet. Seems there is a lot of padding around knuckles, but the wrist support isn’t quite as good as I’m used to. Getting them on and off is a little more difficult than the gloves I was used to.
customer_reviews.author: Lee W.

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They're what I expect from Everlast. I feel like Rocky when I wear them! They fit well and I have good control. They are very durable and keep their structure. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazin Raisin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: I was i excited about the gloves coming in .and i tried them on there comftorable but hand get sweaty. I used them for 5 min and they got scratched [cheap materail] and not good stiching. Im not sure if im going to be returning them .but hey what you pay for is what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail garcia

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these to try out boxing and turns out I love it. the gloves are great without having to ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality glove for a newbie. I ordered these to try out boxing and turns out I love it. the gloves are great without having to spend a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Geena

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves with great style
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit like....well...a glove. I like the style and comfort. The impact is minimal on my bad shoulders and overall really like these gloves. On my 'weigh' to a great weight training start. I know cheesy but that's me!!
customer_reviews.author: TAMARA GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up for my kickboxing class because I didn't want to use the loaners. They are pretty stiff at first and I recommend hand wraps until the break in. But other than that I haven't had any issues. They are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RR Reviews

customer_reviews.title: A little big for women's hands; otherwise GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I just started doing a HIIT Boxing class and bought these to get me started. They have been great so far. They are slightly large for women's hands even with wraps. I got the 16oz training gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Loving these gloves so far.  Nice upgrade from the ones that came with my heavybag.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say if they are durable as I have only owned them for a few months. They are comfortable though, and it's easy to fasten the velcro with your teeth to get that second glove on.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Chapin

customer_reviews.title: Good for training beginners
customer_reviews.text: I like them for training people, but like most other products from China They are quickly losing their shape and loosening up. Price was good though, don't know about durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: WW Shank

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Put a Price on Hygiene...
customer_reviews.text: A totally reasonable price and good product that saves you from using the nasty community gloves at your gym. A must-have for any classes involving boxing gloves. Contrary to other reviews, our gloves did not gave off any odd smells or odors when opened and first used.
customer_reviews.author: Big Blue Review

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this product in an attempt to start a pro boxing career. It felt right when I put it on and tested it out on my little brother. I instantly KO'd him and have never felt that type of power before. One afternoon I was walking out of my Zumba Fitness class when I stumbled upon an in-progress robbery. I knew with great power comes great responsibility so once I tightened the Velcro strap that robber was in trouble. I got shot and the gloves were stripped from my possession. 5/5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. I recently joined a boxing gym and these are the perfect pair of gloves. They are light weight and easy to take on and off even when my hands are wrapped. I went ahead and got a pair for my husband too! We both love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Only used them twice since I got them and they're pretty okay. Quality is 3/5. I see a few stitches out. Fit is just right for me. Love the color. Feel like an old school boxer with the redness. Love how there is a bag. Just hate how it gets flat. We'll see how they do after more use.
customer_reviews.author: Myrjam Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Only one complaint
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that I wish the Velcro wrapped all the way around for people with small wrists like me. I used to own Title Boxing gloves and they wrapped all the way around allowing for a tighter grip. If you have small wrists please consider that.
customer_reviews.author: cwoodman

customer_reviews.title: Knuckle pads
customer_reviews.text: What can I say but it works as it should. Don’t expect it to be as comfy as a boxing gloves but it keeps your knuckles protected from constant pounding to the punching bag. Not sure if it will last a year though but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: StevenS

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boxing exercise and I am glad that I chose this item. The materials use is top notch and it is comfortable to use. Also it has such nice grip on my hand and gives a great punch and it comes with different colors.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLa

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for begginers/intermediates
customer_reviews.text: Gloves look exactly like on a picture, love them. Good gloves for good price, especially for beginners. I used to using leather gloves and that leather smell was really bad, I am glad that this time I decided to buy synthetic. Unfortunally this may be con too, because durabality is lower. Anyway I prefer this synthetic ones. Also part on palms is made with textile for ventilation, so hands don't sweat that much.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette Cizova

customer_reviews.title: Velcro won’t stay securely shut
customer_reviews.text: I usually love these gloves (2nd time I’ve ordered them). I’ve had them for 2 months and the right glove will not remain secure and keeps flapping open in the middle of boxing. Maybe I have a defective item as I didn’t experience last time but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Solid, Powerful, and Easy Fit.
customer_reviews.text: These are weighted nicely. Great for beginners, it helps with training without being too intense. You just feel powerful when you put these on. I recommend buying it with wraps in order to keep the inside dry and so it fits properly around the wrist. These don't stink up either, and can easily be cleaned with disinfectant wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste B.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I was SUPER nervous ordering these online because I did not know what kind of quality i would get ---- they are AMAZING quality and great for my husband to use! he loves them
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Boxing gloves
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about this product: great fit, easy to put on and take off, very durable and good support. What I disliked about this product: not good as oven mitts, no good for yard work, not comfortable while driving, and swimming is right out.
customer_reviews.author: TriToad

customer_reviews.title: For beginners
customer_reviews.text: These lasted about 6 months. After that the padding started to fade and glove strifes to deteriorate. I had no choice but to upgrade to another brand. Great for the price point and beginners.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Beware TFCC injury, no wrist support
customer_reviews.text: Beware TFCC injury. There’s no wrist support in these gloves. It essentially turns feels like the material is wrapped around your wrist like cardboard, not molded or melding to fit your wrist at all. I tried them out for one practice, not even very heavy work, just punching of pads held by another person and wound up with a serious TFCC injury (sprain of cartilage on the outer wrist area). It puts you out of commission for 6-8 weeks or more! Very sad but sometimes cheapest is just not the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy and hands seem well protected
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned at first because no thumb part. Found them a little more difficult to pull on then last gloves, I see what other reviewer stated about long fingers may be issue, I have short fat hands and fingers seem all the way to end. Padding and weight seem good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved this gift she received for Christmas from her father and me. Our son trains as well, and now they work out together! These gloves are stronger than they look, and they fit well. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Hay

customer_reviews.title: If you want decent better gloves then you should do more research
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay glove for beginners, these gloves only lasted me for about a year. If you want decent better gloves then you should do more research. Right now I am using Fairtex gloves and they are about $70. *I train Muay Thai for 2 years 5 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Leang

customer_reviews.title: Easy on, watch out heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: They've got a thin solid bit just far enough for you to grip with your fingers but not think enough to prevent movement. The said, these have been a regular go to at the gym for me. Nice to hit the heavy bag for 15-20mins at a time without serious damage, but they are just loose enough to not protect your wrists fully so be careful on your swings. Some stay velcro straps would do wonders for these, but overall, have been very happy with them and their durability.
customer_reviews.author: stayathomedad

customer_reviews.title: They should sell them as a subscription because they don’t last more than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I mean, you get what you pay for. This gloves do not offer any wrist support, as soon as I started using them I felt my wrist and elbows hurting, regardless of how I wrapped my hands (I tried different levels of pressure and n out hung helped). Besides the lack of support or protection, this gloves only lasted 3 months. I got them in September and at the beginning of January they were falling apart, and I say 3 months because I took a month-long trip in which I did not use the gloves at all. Save your money, and buy a pair that’ll last
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but they wear pretty quickly
customer_reviews.text: I will haven't spent as much time with these as I should, but there's already obvious wear along the stitches/seams. They do pad well for heavy bag cardio type work, but they aren't amazing durability-wise.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: The glove for the left side, for some reason, has a smaller fingertip space/compartment than the right side and it gets uncomfortable as I am wearing it for a while, but I didn’t bother to return them. I wished they had better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Horrible gloves. I thought that the brand 'everlast' meant ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible gloves. I thought that the brand 'everlast' meant that the gloves were comfortable and supportive. After initially wearing the badboy glove brand, I purchased a pair for myself and immediately threw them off for my badboy gloves. My knuckles were sore and it did not absorb the impact properly. It was also uncomfortable compared to the badboy brand and the blows had a higher impact. Definitely would return or re-sell.
customer_reviews.author: Varsha

customer_reviews.title: Great for the heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for heavy bag work, and I love them. They fit well, with inner gloves used. They wear well, and are comfortable. They come in a nice mesh container to keep them after use - they are able to dry out and don't get gross from sweat. I certainly recommend them, and will likely buy another pair when the time comes. There are many on the market, but I'm glad I chose this pair.
customer_reviews.author: LakesideGlass

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive. Would not recommend for sparring or bag work since they don't hold up well. I had to re-sew the velcro strap because it ripped straight off the stretchy material used to secure the glove to your wrist. If you're serious about training, bag work, or sparring, buy a decent pair.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these to start boxing at the gym with my trainer. I highly recommend them and like them a lot. Hands get very sweaty so I wouldn't share.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Alfieri

product_meta.title: Everlast Pro Style Training Gloves
product_meta.description:
This glove protects the wrist against hyperflexion while providing comfort & protection no matter how hard you're hitting.

Warranty:

Everlast warrants its products to be free from defects in materials and workmanship for a period of 120 days from date of purchase, provided they have not been subjected to obvious abuse, neglect or misuse. Everlast's sole liability is limited to repairing or replacing products that are returned within this 120-day period, unless specific product literature specifies otherwise.

Please contact customer service for full details, and for replacement assistance at 1-800-821-7930.



AMAZON.COM
Everlast Pro Style Training Gloves are made of tough and durable Everhide and designed with an extra layer of foam for added protection during training and sparring. Naturally contoured to the shape of the fist and thumb, the gloves allow for greater maneuverability, control and protection. The wrists are fully padded on both sides to keep hands in proper position while punching, with the special Thumb-lok feature providing additional support. A wide wraparound Velcro strap is easy to adjust and provides a secure and comfortable fit.

 About Everlast
The name Everlast is synonymous with boxing. Renown internationally as a manufacturer of boxing equipment, Everlast started out as a swimwear manufacturer in 1910. Headquartered in the Bronx, NY, the company was founded by 17-year-old Jacob Golomb. The son of a tailor and an avid swimmer, Jacob Golomb was dissatisfied with the durability of swimsuits because they barely lasted a season, so he began making suits that he guaranteed would last for a full year. He proudly gave them the name, Everlast. Although the swimsuits did not last through the years, the name did.

 Over the next years, Golomb expanded his company into a small retail store that carried a full line of sports equipment. In 1917, a young fighter named Jack Dempsey introduced boxing to Golomb and Everlast. Dempsey asked Golomb to construct protective headgear that would last more than 15 rounds of intensive boxing training. Golomb specially designed the training gear for Dempsey. In 1919, Dempsey won the world’s heavyweight championship wearing boxing gloves made for him by Golomb. Everlast became the headquarters for boxing equipment throughout the world. In 1925, Golomb designed elastic-waist trunks to replace the leather-belted trunks then worn by boxers. These trunks, now known as boxer trunks, immediately became famous. Jacob Golomb ran the business until he passed away in the early 1950’s and his son, Dan, took over. In 1958, Ben Nadorf joined Everlast and purchased 50% of the company from the Golomb family. When Dan Golomb passed away in 1995, Nadorf purchased the family’s remaining 50% interest. Nadorf remained the President and Principle Share Holder of Everlast until October 24, 2000.

 Everlast men’s and women’s apparel and accessories continue today to be tremendously successful both inside and outside the ring. In addition, Everlast boxing trunks and equipment remain the proud and undefeated champion of the boxing industry for more than 90 years. The history continues, as the name states. Everlast has a traditional past and a knockout future.

 What’s in the Box?
One pair of training gloves

 Manufacturer Warranty
1 year
